name: misimpression
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an idea or opinion about something that is not correct: leave a misimpression The story may have left a misimpression about what happened. I want to correct the misimpression that has been given by the newspaper.
More examplesFewer examplesLet me take this opportunity to clarify the misimpression that I may have left in my earlier speech.Her claims left a lasting misimpression about the events.Several people seem to be under the misimpression that I am in favour of these proposals.They have done nothing to correct the misimpression.
